uqa.qa_gen module¶

Natural question / answer pairs generation.

Using output of ner and constituency parsing steps this module implements rules to generate question / answer pairs in natural looking French.

Notes

For visualization purposes question / anwser pairs generation process is split in 2 steps:

  1. Matching interesting patterns in sentences constituency and / or named entity (see rule1() and rule1_ext())

  2. Generating the questions answers from those patterns (see rule1_to_qa())

uqa.qa_gen.use_qword_quel(txt: str) → bool[source]¶

(unused). Analyse txt and returns True if the generated question should use ‘quel’ question word.

Returns True if a superlative or an ordinal is found in the sentence.

uqa.qa_gen.Rule1_RT = typing.List[typing.Tuple[uqa.context_utils.LabelNode, uqa.context_utils.Label]]¶

Return type of rule1() and rule1_ext()

uqa.qa_gen.rule1(context: uqa.context_utils.Context) → List[Tuple[uqa.context_utils.LabelNode, uqa.context_utils.Label]][source]¶

Extract ‘NP-SUJ’, ‘VN’, ‘NP-ATS’ constituents continuous subsequence in sentence if ‘NP-SUJ’ contains a single named entity.

Returns

Rule1_RT – A list of pairs. Each pair first element is a LabelNode with ‘NP-SUJ’, ‘VN’, ‘NP-ATS’ labels as children and second element is the NER label.

uqa.qa_gen.rule1_ext(context: uqa.context_utils.Context) → List[Tuple[uqa.context_utils.LabelNode, uqa.context_utils.Label]][source]¶

Extract ‘NP-SUJ’ – ‘VN’ – ‘NP-ATS’ or ‘NP-SUJ’ – ‘VN’ – ‘NP-ATS + PP’ constituents subsequence in sentence if ‘NP-SUJ’ contains a single named entity.

Here subsequence corresponds with the mathematical definition (see find_subseq_spaced())
If ‘NP-ATS’ is followed by a ‘PP’ constituent ‘NP-ATS’ and ‘PP’ are merged into a single constituent.
Returns

Rule1_RT – A list of pairs. Each pair first element is a LabelNode with constituents labels as children and second element is the NER label.

uqa.qa_gen.rule1_to_qa(context: uqa.context_utils.Context, rule1_ret: List[Tuple[uqa.context_utils.LabelNode, uqa.context_utils.Label]]) → None[source]¶

Generate question / answer pairs from either rule1() or rule1_ext() outputs.

Parameters

  • context (Context) – Context instance for which rule1_ret is derived, generated QA are stored in context qas attribute.

  • rule1_ret (Rule1_RT) – The ouptut of either rule1() or rule1_ext() applied to context

uqa.qa_gen.generate_qas_context_it(context_it: Iterable[uqa.context_utils.Context], filter_no_qa: bool = True) → Iterable[uqa.context_utils.Context][source]¶

Generate question / answers pairs on a context iterable.

NER and constituency parsing steps must have been realized prior to q/a generation.

Parameters

data_it (Iterable[Context]) – A context iterable.

Returns

DataIterble – The processed dateset iterable.

uqa.qa_gen.generate_qas_dl(data_it: Iterable[Tuple[str, Union[Dict, List]]]) → Iterable[Tuple[str, Union[Dict, List]]][source]¶

Generate question / answers pairs on a dataset.

NER and constituency parsing steps must have been realized prior to q/a generation.

Parameters

data_it (DataIterble) – A dateset iterable in default format.

Returns

DataIterble – The processed dateset iterable.
